009package imagingbook.pub.matching;
010
011import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
012
013/**
014 * Objects of this class calculate an approximate distance transform of a given
015 * image which is assumed to be binary (pixel value 0 = background, foreground otherwise).
016 * 
017 * @author W. Burger
018 * @version 2014-04-20
019 */
020public class DistanceTransform {
021        
022        public enum Norm {L1, L2}
023        private final float[][] D;
024        
025        // default constructor (using L2 norm)
026        public DistanceTransform(ImageProcessor I) {
027                 this(I, Norm.L2);
028        }
029        
030        // alternate constructor (L1 or L2 norm)
031        public DistanceTransform(ImageProcessor I, Norm norm) {
032                D = makeDistanceMap(I, norm);
033        }
034        
035        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
036        
037        private float[][] makeDistanceMap(ImageProcessor I, Norm norm) {
038                float m1, m2;
039                switch (norm) {
040                case L1:
041                        m1 = 1; m2 = 2; break;
042                case L2:
043                        m1 = 1; m2 = (float) Math.sqrt(2); break;
044                default:
045                        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
046                }
047                
048                final int M = I.getWidth();
049                final int N = I.getHeight();
050                final float[][] D = new float[M][N];
051                float d0, d1, d2, d3;
052
053                // L->R pass:
054                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
055                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
056                                if (I.get(u, v) > 0) {          // a foreground pixel
057                                        D[u][v] = 0;
058                                }
059                                else {                                          // a background pixel
060                                        d0 = d1 = d2 = d3 = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
061                                        if (u > 0) {
062                                                d0 = m1 + D[u - 1][v];
063                                                if (v > 0)      {
064                                                        d1 = m2 + D[u - 1][v - 1];
065                                                }
066                                        }
067                                        if (v > 0) {
068                                                d2 = m1 + D[u][v - 1];
069                                                if (u < M - 1) {
070                                                        d3 = m2 + D[u + 1][v - 1];
071                                                }
072                                        }
073                                        // at this point D[u][v] == POSITIVE_INFINITY
074                                        D[u][v] = min(d0, d1, d2, d3);  
075                                }
076                        }
077                }
078                
079                // R->L pass:
080                for (int v = N - 1; v >= 0; v--) {
081                        for (int u = M - 1; u >= 0; u--) {
082                                if (D[u][v] > 0) {      // a background pixel
083                                        d0 = d1 = d2 = d3 = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
084                                        if (u < M - 1)  {
085                                                d0 = m1 + D[u + 1][v];
086                                                if (v < N - 1) {
087                                                        d1 = m2 + D[u + 1][v + 1];
088                                                }
089                                        }
090                                        if (v < N - 1) {
091                                                d2 = m1 + D[u][v + 1];
092                                                if (u > 0) {
093                                                        d3 = m2 + D[u - 1][v + 1];
094                                                }
095                                        }
096                                        D[u][v] = min(D[u][v], d0, d1, d2, d3);
097                                }
098                        }
099                }
100                return D;
101        }
102        
103        private float min(float... a) {
104                float minVal = a[0];
105                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
106                        if (a[i] < minVal) 
107                                minVal = a[i];
108                }
109                return minVal;
110        }
111        
112        public float[][] getDistanceMap() {
113                return D;
114        }
115        
116
117}
